009package imagingbook.common.filter.linear;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013/**
014 * This class represents a 2D filter kernel.
015 * 
016 * @author WB
017 * @version 2020/12/29
018 */
019public class GaussianKernel1D extends Kernel1D {
020        
021        public static final double SIZE_FACTOR = 3.5;   
022        
023        public GaussianKernel1D(double sigma) {
024                super(makeGaussKernel1D(sigma));
025        }
026
027        // ----------------------------------------------------------------
028        
029        /**
030         * Creates and returns a 1D Gaussian filter kernel large enough
031         * to avoid truncation effects. The length of the resulting array is odd.
032         * The returned kernel is normalized.
033         * 
034         * @param sigma the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian
035         * @return the Gaussian filter kernel
036         */
037        public static float[] makeGaussKernel1D(double sigma) {
038                return makeGaussKernel1D(sigma, true);
039        }
040        
041        /**
042         * Creates and returns a 1D Gaussian filter kernel large enough
043         * to avoid truncation effects. The length of the resulting array is odd.
044         * The returned kernel is optionally normalized.
045         * 
046         * @param sigma the width (standard deviation) of the Gaussian
047         * @param normalize set true to normalize the kernel
048         * @return the Gaussian filter kernel
049         */
050        public static float[] makeGaussKernel1D(double sigma, boolean normalize) {
051                if (sigma < 0) {
052                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("positive sigma required for Gaussian kernel");
053                }
054                final int rad = (int) Math.ceil(SIZE_FACTOR * sigma);
055                final int size = rad + rad + 1;
056                final float[] kernel = new float[size]; // odd size, center cell = kernel[rad]
057                final double sigma2 = sqr(sigma);
058                
059                for (int i = 0; i < kernel.length; i++) {
060                        kernel[i] = (float) Math.exp(-0.5 * sqr(rad - i) / sigma2);
061                }
062                
063                return (normalize) ? normalize(kernel) : kernel;
064        }
065        
066}
